courseDescription:
This course provides you with an in-depth understanding of the main types of isomers sums. If you want to explore the general concept of, and terminologies in thermodynamics - as well as the different forms of energy - then sign up for free. This course takes you through the classification of the alkenes and alkynes, as well as the physical and chemical properties of alkenes. It introduces you to the nomenclature of alkenes and alkynes, and the naming of alkenes. Study positional isomers together with preparation of alkanes. You will learn how organic compounds can be classified, as well as how some of the major functional groups can be circled. Have you analyzed the concept of ring compounds in organic chemistry? This course will teach you the functional groups that can be adopted.

Before working with structural RepN, and the bold-line structure, it is important to understand the structural isomers that are applicable as well as the concept, classifications and subclassifications of hydrocarbons. You will be able to explain the mechanism for energy transfer and the main types of thermodynamic processes. Furthermore, this course helps you understand the forms of energy transfer together with the laws of thermodynamics. Do you know there are specific illustrations of a system, surroundings, and boundary in thermodynamics? The material illustrates the Zeroth law and the law of conservation of energy. It explains how the first law of thermodynamics can be applied in a closed system and the enthalpies for different types of reactions. You will also learn about the process of determining thermodynamic favorability and feasibility.

Furthermore, you will also learn how chemical reaction energy can be transferred between the different species. Study reactions and the surroundings in which the reaction can take place. Do you know there are activities involved in internal energy? This course will help you get a better understanding of the definition of special heat and the kinds of special heat in a fluid. It explains in detail the concept of enthalpies, features of the standard enthalpy and Hess's law. You will also learn about the driving forces of a chemical reaction, the definition of Gibbs free energy and the effect of standard state enthalpy. It also discusses the thermodynamic favorability of chemical reactions and the different cases that can be used to determine it. This free online organic chemistry course is useful to all high school science students, those needing a refresher or those taking the AP (Advanced Placement) chemistry exams. Simply create an account and enroll, for free.
